entries.notes: Op. 9 no. 3 of 1770 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue. Picquot writes (p. 114): 'This third quartet begins in the Vénier edition with an Allegro assai, while in the thematic catalogue drawn up by Boccherini the'

first_edition: (c. 1785), London, Preston: Op. 10 no. 2 (for title, see No. 171)
(c. 1790), Paris, Boyer: Op. 10 no. 2 (for title, see No. 171)
sources.modern_edition: (c. 1930), Leipzig, Peters: Op. 10 no. 2 (separate parts; revised by R. Hofmann). This edition was re-published c. 1943? by the International Music Co., New York.

continues_from_previous.arrangements: Of the first movement, as part of a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte or harp) and violin, perhaps by Naderman, c. 1778 (see No. 42).
